manual.title: Quick User Guide
manual.lead: Follow these steps to set up and control your Walrus Audio Mako pedals.

items.prereq: Prerequisites: Node.js 18+, Chrome/Edge in HTTPS or localhost (Web MIDI).
items.dev: Dev: `npm run dev` then open http://localhost:5173.
items.build: Build: `npm run build` for HTTPS deployment.

items.menu: Menu (gear): pick MIDI output, change language, read tips.
items.board: Board: side list to select/remove pedals; cards show controls for the active pedal.
items.modes: Mode switch: Live sends immediately; Preset keeps changes as drafts with a dirty counter.
items.importExport: Import/Export buttons on each card for preset JSON files.

items.open: Click ‚ÄúAdd pedal‚Äù (+) to open the dialog.
items.pick: Choose the pedal model (D1/M1/R1/ACS1 or any other JSON present).
items.channel: Pick a MIDI channel (a free channel is suggested) and confirm.
items.edit: Use the ‚úé button on a card to change model/channel later.

items.live: Live: each change sends its CC immediately and becomes the new committed value.
items.preset: Preset: changes stay in draft; a badge counts pending controls.
items.apply: Apply: sends only the dirty controls, then resets the counter.
items.cancel: Cancel: restores committed values without sending MIDI.

items.manual: Enter a PC number in the allowed range then click ‚ÄúSelect‚Äù.
items.banks: If banks are defined, choose a bank then click a preset button.
items.bankSwitch: When a bankSwitch control exists, it is sent before the PC to align the pedal.

items.export: Export: downloads a JSON with device, channel, committed control values, timestamp.
items.import: Import: loads a JSON, selects device/channel if present, updates UI/storage without sending MIDI.

items.storage: Board, channels, order, committed values, locale, mode are saved in localStorage.
items.pwa: The app is installable (PWA) and caches core assets.
items.troubleshootMidi: If no MIDI outputs: use HTTPS/localhost, allow MIDI access, then refresh the list.
